log.content: Create me a website about 3d printers. Make it technical and informative, including information such as calibration, what process should be followed after changing filament etc. Add lots of detail and use a modern design language with the main color being orange. You should create multiple pages, but make sure the main page is available in index.html

function.name: create_file
function.arguments:
{"filename":"index.html","content":" 3D Printer Guide

3D Printer Technical Documentation

  • Calibration
  • Filament Change Process

Welcome to 3D Printer Documentation

This resource provides comprehensive technical information for 3D printer maintenance, operation, and troubleshooting. The main color scheme is orange (#FFA500) with a modern design.

Calibration Process

  • Bed Leveling: Use the 'bed leveling' tool in Cura or Pronterface to adjust Z-axis height. Recommended method: 3-point leveling with a sheet of paper between the nozzle and bed.
  • Extruder Calibration: Measure print accuracy by printing calibration cubes. Adjust X/Y travel limits in your printer's firmware if necessary.
  • Temperature Settings: Calibrate hotend temperatures for PLA (200-240°C), ABS (230-250°C), and PETG (235-245°C) based on material specifications.

Post-Filament Change Procedure

  1. Clean Nozzle: Use isopropyl alcohol to remove residual filament from the nozzle. Check for clogs in the extruder gear.
  2. Adjust Retraction: Increase retraction distance (12-20mm) and speed (40-60mm/s) to prevent oozing after filament change.
  3. Test Print: Perform a 3D printed calibration cube to verify print quality. Check for under-extrusion or over-extrusion issues.
  4. Update Firmware: Ensure printer firmware is up-to-date with the latest bug fixes and feature enhancements.

© 2023 3D Printer Documentation. All rights reserved.

"}

function.name: create_file
create_file
function.arguments:
{"filename":"calibration.html","content":" 3D Printer Calibration

Calibration Guide for 3D Printers

  • Home
  • Filament Change Process

Bed Leveling Techniques

Proper bed leveling is critical for first-layer adhesion. Use the following methods:

  • 3-Point Leveling: Place three probes on the bed and adjust each corner until they touch the surface.
  • Touch Probe Method: Use a probe to measure Z-axis height at multiple points across the bed.
  • Automatic Bed Leveling (ABL): Utilize a sensor to create a mesh map of the bed surface.

Extruder Calibration

Ensure your extruder is properly calibrated for accurate print quality:

  • Measure the diameter of the nozzle using a micrometer.
  • Adjust the printer's firmware for proper gear ratio calculations.
  • Print calibration cubes to verify extrusion accuracy.

© 2023 3D Printer Documentation. All rights reserved.

"}

function.name: create_file
function.arguments:
{"filename":"filament-change.html","content":" Post-Filament Change Procedure

3D Printer Filament Change Guide

  • Home
  • Calibration

Step-by-Step Filament Change Procedure

  1. Prepare the Printer: Ensure the printer is powered off and the bed is level.
  2. Load New Filament: Insert the new filament into the extruder and set the correct temperature in your slicing software.
  3. Clean Nozzle: Use a nozzle cleaning tool to remove residual material from the extruder.
  4. Test Print: Perform a 3D printed calibration cube to verify print quality after filament change.

Post-Filament Change Checks

  • Check for under-extrusion or over-extrusion during print test.
  • Verify that the printer's firmware is updated with latest filament change fixes.
  • Ensure all mechanical components are properly aligned after changing filament.

© 2023 3D Printer Documentation. All rights reserved.

"}
